text.tspan: Schematic, Layout, DRC, LVS, spice netlist
Actively maintained: fast bugs corrections, periodic
Layout is done in a different way, easy to learn
Magic: We use only parasitic extraction and netlist
generation feature of this layout tool
Pros: More accurate than Electric, widely used
Cons: Need to write another techfile for this tool
processes and Deep Submicron is a grey zone
Pros: Fast simulator, scales better than ngspice and
LTSpice. Plugins system usefull for use other netlist
syntax (such as spectre, spice3f5, verilog-ams) or
compile new simulation models without compiling
There is a fork which implements icarus verilog
Cons: Lacks some simulation analisys such as
noise (it is being developed now, not yet available
spice3f5, Cider and Xspice which gives us a mixed-
Pros: Widely used and support several analysis and
simulation models, mot-adms model compiler can
be used for verilog-ams models. Output can be
retrieved by the electric waveform viewer, or using
Cons: It is slower than gnucap and needs to be
recompiled when a new simulation model is added.
Schematic, Layout, DRC, LVS, spice netlist
Magic VLSI: Parasitic Extraction, netlist gen.
